Process of the Águas Claras Mine – MAC As part of the ongoing closure process of the Águas Claras Mine (MAC), Vale will hold a public meeting to present the Mine Closure Environmental Plan (PAFEM) and address questions from the community regarding the environmental and social aspects of the mine’s decommissioning, as well as the proposed future use of the mined area. 9/10/2025 7:00 PM Águas Claras Mine – MAC, Building 4 Av. Dr. Marco Paulo Simon Jardim, 3580 – Nova Lima/MG Closure Plan SEI FEAM Process No.: 2090.01.0002912/2022-17 The Mine Closure Environmental Plan (PAFEM) is a technical document that outlines the guidelines for the safe and responsible deactivation of a mine, covering environmental, social, and economic aspects. Its objective is to minimize the negative impacts of mining activities and promote a sustainable transition for the area following mine closure, taking into account future land use and the legacy for the local community. Click here to access the MAC PAFEM Sign up here to receive updates about the Public Meeting IMPORTANT: The public meeting is open to all, free of charge, and does not require registration to attend. Signing up through this link is solely for those who wish to receive information via e-mail. How to get there? Vale Free Transportation Vale will provide free bus routes to the meeting, departing from neighborhoods in Nova Lima. Register for the route that best suits you here! Private Vehicle Upon arrival at the MAC gate, follow the signs toward Building 4, where the Public Meeting will take place. After parking, proceed to the Casa Uso Futuro via the yellow staircase located next to Building 4. Our team will be available to assist you if needed. For parking spaces designated for individuals with reduced mobility, drivers will be guided by our on-site staff. Please respect the speed limit of 40 km/h and arrive safely. If arriving by motorcycle, due to mine safety protocols, you will be directed to park near the gate and use the internal shuttle to reach Building 4. Need more information? Contact us via Alô Vale at 0800 285 7000 or reach out to FEAM at (31) 3915-1105 / 3915-1442. Photo: Washington Alves Context History of the Águas Claras Mine and its new cycle of use The Águas Claras Mine is a territory undergoing transformation. After decades of contributing to the region’s economic development, the area is entering a new phase. The goal is to leave a positive legacy for both the environment and the community, fostering a renewed relationship between society and the territory. Progress and completed milestones The project has already achieved key milestones: Submission of the Mine Closure Environmental Plan (PAFEM) in December 2023 Initiation of stabilization and land adaptation works Ongoing feasibility studies for future land uses Expansion of publicly accessible areas Execution of pilot events and community engagement activities Expected impacts for the Nova Lima and Belo Horizonte region The project aims to deliver tangible benefits to the region, including: Expansion of green areas and conservation of the Jambreiro Forest Creation of new leisure and sustainable tourism opportunities Enhancement of the landscape and natural heritage Promotion of culture and environmental education Development of opportunities for the local economy How the Future Use Project is built with community participation Community engagement is essential to ensure that the future use of MAC reflects the needs and aspirations of all stakeholders. The project is built on a continuous process of active listening, which has already gathered input from more than 7,000 people to date. Learn more about the MAC Future Use Project by clicking here Photo: Washington Alves About Vale We are a mining company and serve as the foundation of a value chain that contributes to societal development. We harness the potential of natural resources, transforming them into essential elements for life and for building the future.
